t: Hosea 1
Hosea’s Wife and Children

The*p word of the Lord*s which came to Hosea the son of Beeri, during the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and*i Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.

When*p the Lord*s first spoke through Hosea, the Lord*s said to Hosea, “Go, take to yourself a wife of harlotry and have*i children of harlotry; for the land commits flagrant harlotry, forsaking the Lord.”*s
So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
And the Lord*s said to him, “Name him Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will punish the house of Jehu for the bloodshed of Jezreel, and I will put an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
On that day I will break the bow of Israel in the valley of Jezreel.”
Then*p she conceived again and gave birth to a daughter. And the Lord*s said to him, “Name her Lo-ruhamah, for I will no longer have compassion on the house of Israel, that I would ever forgive them.
But I will have compassion on the house of Judah and deliver them by the Lord*s their God, and will not deliver them by bow, sword, battle, horses or horsemen.”
When*p she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and gave birth to a son.
And the Lord*s said, “Name him Lo-ammi, for you are not My people and I am not your God.”

Yet*pn the number of the sons of Israel Will*ln be like the sand of the sea, Which*ln cannot be measured or numbered; And*ln in the place Where*ln it is said to them, “You*ln are not My people,” It*ln will be said to them, “You*iln are*i the sons of the living God.”

And*ln the sons of Judah and the sons of Israel will be gathered together, And*ln they will appoint for themselves one leader, And*ln they will go up from the land, For*ln great will be the day of Jezreel.
Hosea 2
Israel’s Unfaithfulness Condemned
Say*p to your brothers, “Ammi,” and to your sisters, “Ruhamah.”
“Contend*pn with your mother, contend, For*ln she is not my wife, and I am not her husband; And*ln let her put away her harlotry from her face And*ln her adultery from between her breasts,
Or*ln I will strip her naked And*ln expose her as on the day when she was born. I*ln will also make her like a wilderness, Make*ln her like desert land And*ln slay her with thirst.
Also,*ln I will have no compassion on her children, Because*ln they are children of harlotry.

For*ln their mother has played the harlot; She*ln who conceived them has acted shamefully. For*ln she said, ‘I will go after my lovers, Who*ln give me*i my bread and my water, My*ln wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.’
Therefore,*ln behold, I will hedge up her way with thorns, And*ln I will build a wall against her so that she cannot find her paths.

She*ln will pursue her lovers, but she will not overtake them; And*ln she will seek them, but will not find them.*i Then*ln she will say, ‘I will go back to my first husband, For*ln it was better for me then than now!’
“For*ln she does not know that it was I who gave her the grain, the new wine and the oil, And*ln lavished on her silver and gold, Which*iln they used for Baal.
Therefore,*ln I will take back My grain at harvest time And*ln My new wine in its season. I*ln will also take away My wool and My flax Given*iln to cover her nakedness.
And*ln then I will uncover her lewdness In*ln the sight of her lovers, And*ln no one will rescue her out of My hand.
I*ln will also put an end to all her gaiety, Her*ln feasts, her new moons, her sabbaths And*ln all her festal assemblies.

I*ln will destroy her vines and fig trees, Of*ln which she said, ‘These are my wages Which*ln my lovers have given me.’ And*ln I will make them a forest, And*ln the beasts of the field will devour them.

I*ln will punish her for the days of the Baals When*ln she used to offer sacrifices to them And*ln adorn herself with her earrings and jewelry, And*ln follow her lovers, so that she forgot Me,” declares the Lord.*s
Restoration of Israel
“Therefore,*pn behold, I will allure her, Bring*ln her into the wilderness And*ln speak kindly to her.

Then*ln I will give her her vineyards from there, And*ln the valley of Achor as a door of hope. And*ln she will sing there as in the days of her youth, As*ln in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
It*ln will come about in that day,” declares the Lord,*s “That*ln you will call Me Ishi And*ln will no longer call Me Baali.
For*ln I will remove the names of the Baals from her mouth, So*ln that they will be mentioned by their names no more.

In*ln that day I will also make a covenant for them With*ln the beasts of the field, The*ln birds of the sky And*ln the creeping things of the ground. And*ln I will abolish the bow, the sword and war from the land, And*ln will make them lie down in safety.
I*ln will betroth you to Me forever; Yes,*ln I will betroth you to Me in righteousness and in justice, In*ln lovingkindness and in compassion,
And*ln I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness. Then*ln you will know the Lord.*s
“It*ln will come about in that day that I will respond,” declares the Lord.*s “I*ln will respond to the heavens, and they will respond to the earth,
And*ln the earth will respond to the grain, to the new wine and to the oil, And*ln they will respond to Jezreel.

I*ln will sow her for Myself in the land. I*ln will also have compassion on her who had not obtained compassion, And*ln I will say to those who were not My people, ‘You*ln are My people!’ And*ln they will say, ‘You*i are*i my God!’ ”
Hosea 3
Hosea’s Second Symbolic Marriage

Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Go again, love a woman who*i is loved by her*i husband, yet an adulteress, even as the Lord*s loves the sons of Israel, though they turn to other gods and love raisin cakes.”
So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels*i of silver and a homer and a half of barley.
Then I said to her, “You shall stay with me for many days. You shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man; so I will also be toward you.”
For the sons of Israel will remain for many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred*i pillar and without ephod or household idols.
Afterward the sons of Israel will return and seek the Lord*s their God and David their king; and they will come trembling to the Lord*s and to His goodness in the last days.
Hosea 4
God’s Controversy with Israel

Listen*pn to the word of the Lord,*s O sons of Israel, For*ln the Lord*s has a case against the inhabitants of the land, Because*ln there is no faithfulness or kindness Or*ln knowledge of God in the land.
There*iln is*i swearing, deception, murder, stealing and adultery. They*ln employ violence, so that bloodshed follows bloodshed.
Therefore*ln the land mourns, And*ln everyone who lives in it languishes Along*ln with the beasts of the field and the birds of the sky, And*ln also the fish of the sea disappear.
Yet*ln let no one find fault, and let none offer reproof; For*ln your people are like those who contend with the priest.
So*ln you will stumble by day, And*ln the prophet also will stumble with you by night; And*ln I will destroy your mother.

My*ln people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because*ln you have rejected knowledge, I*ln also will reject you from being My priest. Since*ln you have forgotten the law of your God, I*ln also will forget your children.
The*ln more they multiplied, the more they sinned against Me; I*ln will change their glory into shame.
They*ln feed on the sin of My people And*ln direct their desire toward their iniquity.
And*ln it will be, like people, like priest; So*ln I will punish them for their ways And*ln repay them for their deeds.
They*ln will eat, but not have enough; They*ln will play the harlot, but not increase, Because*ln they have stopped giving heed to the Lord.*s
Harlotry,*ln wine and new wine take away the understanding.
My*ln people consult their wooden idol, and their diviner’s*i wand informs them; For*ln a spirit of harlotry has led them*i astray, And*ln they have played the harlot, departing*i from their God.

They*ln offer sacrifices on the tops of the mountains And*ln burn incense on the hills, Under*ln oak, poplar and terebinth, Because*ln their shade is pleasant. Therefore*ln your daughters play the harlot And*ln your brides commit adultery.

I*ln will not punish your daughters when they play the harlot Or*ln your brides when they commit adultery, For*ln the*i men*i themselves go apart with harlots And*ln offer sacrifices with temple prostitutes; So*ln the people without understanding are ruined.
Though*ln you, Israel, play the harlot, Do*ln not let Judah become guilty; Also*ln do not go to Gilgal, Or*ln go up to Beth-aven And*ln take the oath: “As*ln the Lord*s lives!”
Since*ln Israel is stubborn Like*ln a stubborn heifer, Can*ln the Lord*s now pasture them Like*ln a lamb in a large field?
Ephraim*ln is joined to idols; Let*ln him alone.
Their*ln liquor gone, They*ln play the harlot continually; Their*ln rulers dearly love shame.
The*ln wind wraps them in its wings, And*ln they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Hosea 5
The People’s Apostasy Rebuked
Hear*pn this, O priests! Give*ln heed, O house of Israel! Listen,*ln O house of the king! For*ln the judgment applies to you, For*ln you have been a snare at Mizpah And*ln a net spread out on Tabor.
The*ln revolters have gone deep in depravity, But*ln I will chastise all of them.
I*ln know Ephraim, and Israel is not hidden from Me; For*ln now, O Ephraim, you have played the harlot, Israel*ln has defiled itself.
Their*ln deeds will not allow them To*ln return to their God. For*ln a spirit of harlotry is within them, And*ln they do not know the Lord.*s
Moreover,*ln the pride of Israel testifies against him, And*ln Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity; Judah*ln also has stumbled with them.
They*ln will go with their flocks and herds To*ln seek the Lord,*s but they will not find Him;*i He*ln has withdrawn from them.
They*ln have dealt treacherously against the Lord,*s For*ln they have borne illegitimate children. Now*ln the new moon will devour them with their land.
Blow*ln the horn in Gibeah, The*ln trumpet in Ramah. Sound*ln an alarm at Beth-aven: “Behind*ln you, Benjamin!”
Ephraim*ln will become a desolation in the day of rebuke; Among*ln the tribes of Israel I declare what is sure.
The*ln princes of Judah have become like those who move a boundary; On*ln them I will pour out My wrath like water.
Ephraim*ln is oppressed, crushed in judgment, Because*ln he was determined to follow man’s*i command.
Therefore*ln I am like a moth to Ephraim And*ln like rottenness to the house of Judah.
When*ln Ephraim saw his sickness, And*ln Judah his wound, Then*ln Ephraim went to Assyria And*ln sent to King Jareb. But*ln he is unable to heal you, Or*ln to cure you of your wound.
For*ln I will*i be*i like a lion to Ephraim And*ln like a young lion to the house of Judah. I,*ln even I, will tear to pieces and go away, I*ln will carry away, and there will be none to deliver.
I*ln will go away and*i return to My place Until*ln they acknowledge their guilt and seek My face; In*ln their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.
Hosea 6
The Response to God’s Rebuke
“Come,*pn let us return to the Lord.*s For*ln He has torn us,*i but He will heal us; He*ln has wounded us,*i but He will bandage us.
He*ln will revive us after two days; He*ln will raise us up on the third day, That*ln we may live before Him.
So*ln let us know, let us press on to know the Lord.*s His*ln going forth is as certain as the dawn; And*ln He will come to us like the rain, Like*ln the spring rain watering the earth.”
What*ln shall I do with you, O Ephraim? What*ln shall I do with you, O Judah? For*ln your loyalty is like a morning cloud And*ln like the dew which goes away early.
Therefore*ln I have hewn them*i in pieces by the prophets; I*ln have slain them by the words of My mouth; And*ln the judgments on you are like*i the light that goes forth.
For*ln I delight in loyalty rather than sacrifice, And*ln in the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
But*ln like Adam they have transgressed the covenant; There*ln they have dealt treacherously against Me.
Gilead*ln is a city of wrongdoers, Tracked*ln with bloody footprints.*i
And*ln as raiders wait for a man, So*iln a band of priests murder on the way to Shechem; Surely*ln they have committed crime.
In*ln the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing; Ephraim’s*ln harlotry is there, Israel has defiled itself.
Also,*ln O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for you, When*ln I restore the fortunes of My people.
Hosea 7
Ephraim’s Iniquity
When*pn I would heal Israel, The*ln iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, And*ln the evil deeds of Samaria, For*ln they deal falsely; The*ln thief enters in, Bandits*ln raid outside,
And*ln they do not consider in their hearts That*ln I remember all their wickedness. Now*ln their deeds are all around them; They*ln are before My face.
With*ln their wickedness they make the king glad, And*ln the princes with their lies.
They*ln are all adulterers, Like*ln an oven heated by the baker Who*ln ceases to stir up the*i fire*i From*ln the kneading of the dough until it is leavened.
On*ln the day of our king, the princes became sick with the heat of wine; He*ln stretched out his hand with scoffers,
For*ln their hearts are like an oven As*iln they approach their plotting; Their*ln anger smolders all night, In*ln the morning it burns like a flaming fire.
All*ln of them are hot like an oven, And*ln they consume their rulers; All*ln their kings have fallen. None*ln of them calls on Me.
Ephraim*ln mixes himself with the nations; Ephraim*ln has become a cake not turned.
Strangers*ln devour his strength, Yet*ln he does not know it;*i Gray*ln hairs also are sprinkled on him, Yet*ln he does not know it.*i
Though*ln the pride of Israel testifies against him, Yet*ln they have not returned to the Lord*s their God, Nor*ln have they sought Him, for all this.
So*ln Ephraim has become like a silly dove, without sense; They*ln call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
When*ln they go, I will spread My net over them; I*ln will bring them down like the birds of the sky. I*ln will chastise them in accordance with the proclamation to their assembly.
Woe*ln to them, for they have strayed from Me! Destruction*ln is theirs, for they have rebelled against Me! I*ln would redeem them, but they speak lies against Me.
And*ln they do not cry to Me from their heart When*ln they wail on their beds; For*ln the sake of grain and new wine they assemble themselves, They*ln turn away from Me.
Although*ln I trained and*i strengthened their arms, Yet*ln they devise evil against Me.

They*ln turn, but*i not upward, They*ln are like a deceitful bow; Their*ln princes will fall by the sword Because*ln of the insolence of their tongue. This*ln will*i be*i their derision in the land of Egypt.
Hosea 8
Israel Reaps the Whirlwind
Put*ipn the trumpet to your lips! Like*ln an eagle the*i enemy*i comes*i against the house of the Lord,*s Because*ln they have transgressed My covenant And*ln rebelled against My law.
They*ln cry out to Me, “My*ln God, we of Israel know You!”
Israel*ln has rejected the good; The*ln enemy will pursue him.
They*ln have set up kings, but not by Me; They*ln have appointed princes, but I did not know it.*i With*ln their silver and gold they have made idols for themselves, That*ln they might be cut off.
He*ln has rejected your calf, O Samaria, saying,*i “My*ln anger burns against them!” How*ln long will they be incapable of innocence?
For*ln from Israel is even this! A*ln craftsman made it, so it is not God; Surely*ln the calf of Samaria will be broken to pieces.
For*ln they sow the wind And*ln they reap the whirlwind. The*ln standing grain has no heads; It*ln yields no grain. Should*ln it yield, strangers would swallow it up.
Israel*ln is swallowed up; They*ln are now among the nations Like*ln a vessel in which no one delights.
For*ln they have gone up to Assyria, Like*iln a wild donkey all alone; Ephraim*ln has hired lovers.
Even*ln though they hire allies*i among the nations, Now*ln I will gather them up; And*ln they will begin to diminish Because*ln of the burden of the king of princes.
Since*ln Ephraim has multiplied altars for sin, They*ln have become altars of sinning for him.
Though*ln I wrote for him ten thousand precepts*i of My law, They*ln are regarded as a strange thing.

As*ln for My sacrificial gifts, They*ln sacrifice the flesh and eat it,*i But*iln the Lord*s has taken no delight in them. Now*ln He will remember their iniquity, And*ln punish them*i for their sins; They*ln will return to Egypt.
For*ln Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; And*ln Judah has multiplied fortified cities, But*ln I will send a fire on its cities that it may consume its palatial dwellings.
Hosea 9
Ephraim Punished
Do*pn not rejoice, O Israel, with exultation like the nations! For*ln you have played the harlot, forsaking your God. You*ln have loved harlots’*i earnings on every threshing floor.
Threshing*ln floor and wine press will not feed them, And*ln the new wine will fail them.
They*ln will not remain in the Lord’s*s land, But*ln Ephraim will return to Egypt, And*ln in Assyria they will eat unclean food.*i

They*ln will not pour out drink offerings of wine to the Lord,*s Their*ln sacrifices will not please Him. Their*iln bread*i will*i be*i like mourners’ bread; All*ln who eat of it will be defiled, For*ln their bread will be for themselves alone;*i It*ln will not enter the house of the Lord.*s
What*ln will you do on the day of the appointed festival And*ln on the day of the feast of the Lord?*s
For*ln behold, they will go because of destruction; Egypt*ln will gather them up, Memphis will bury them. Weeds*ln will take over their treasures of silver; Thorns*ln will*i be*i in their tents.

The*ln days of punishment have come, The*ln days of retribution have come; Let*ln Israel know this!*i The*ln prophet is a fool, The*ln inspired man is demented, Because*ln of the grossness of your iniquity, And*ln because*i your hostility is so*i great.
Ephraim*ln was*i a watchman with my God, a prophet; Yet*iln the snare of a bird catcher is in all his ways, And*iln there is only*i hostility in the house of his God.
They*ln have gone deep in depravity As*ln in the days of Gibeah; He*ln will remember their iniquity, He*ln will punish their sins.

I*ln found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I*ln saw your forefathers as the earliest fruit on the fig tree in its first season.*i But*iln they came to Baal-peor and devoted themselves to shame, And*ln they became as detestable as that which they loved.
As*ln for Ephraim, their glory will fly away like a bird— No*ln birth, no pregnancy and no conception!
Though*ln they bring up their children, Yet*ln I will bereave them until not a man is left. Yes,*ln woe to them indeed when I depart from them!
Ephraim,*ln as I have seen, Is*ln planted in a pleasant meadow like Tyre; But*ln Ephraim will bring out his children for slaughter.
Give*ln them, O Lord*s —what will You give? Give*ln them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.

All*ln their evil is at Gilgal; Indeed,*ln I came to hate them there! Because*ln of the wickedness of their deeds I*ln will drive them out of My house! I*ln will love them no more; All*ln their princes are rebels.
Ephraim*ln is stricken, their root is dried up, They*ln will bear no fruit. Even*ln though they bear children, I*ln will slay the precious ones of their womb.
My*ln God will cast them away Because*ln they have not listened to Him; And*ln they will be wanderers among the nations.
Hosea 10
Retribution for Israel’s Sin
Israel*pn is a luxuriant vine; He*ln produces fruit for himself. The*ln more his fruit, The*ln more altars he made; The*ln richer his land, The*ln better he made the sacred*i pillars.
Their*ln heart is faithless; Now*ln they must bear their guilt. The*ln Lord*s will break down their altars And*iln destroy their sacred*i pillars.
Surely*ln now they will say, “We have no king, For*ln we do not revere the Lord.*s As*ln for the king, what can he do for us?”
They*ln speak mere*i words, With*ln worthless oaths they make covenants; And*ln judgment sprouts like poisonous weeds in the furrows of the field.

The*ln inhabitants of Samaria will fear For*ln the calf of Beth-aven. Indeed,*ln its people will mourn for it, And*ln its idolatrous priests will cry out over it, Over*ln its glory, since it has departed from it.
The*ln thing itself will be carried to Assyria As*ln tribute to King Jareb; Ephraim*ln will be seized with shame And*ln Israel will be ashamed of its own counsel.
Samaria*ln will be cut off with*i her king Like*ln a stick on the surface of the water.

Also*ln the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, will be destroyed; Thorn*ln and thistle will grow on their altars; Then*ln they will say to the mountains, “Cover*ln us!” And to the hills, “Fall on us!”
From*ln the days of Gibeah you have sinned, O Israel; There*ln they stand! Will*ln not the battle against the sons of iniquity overtake them in Gibeah?
When*ln it is My desire, I will chastise them; And*ln the peoples will be gathered against them When*ln they are bound for their double guilt.
Ephraim*ln is a trained heifer that loves to thresh, But*ln I will come over her fair neck with*i a*i yoke;*i I*ln will harness Ephraim, Judah*ln will plow, Jacob will harrow for himself.
Sow*ln with a view to righteousness, Reap*ln in accordance with kindness; Break*ln up your fallow ground, For*ln it is time to seek the Lord*s Until*ln He comes to rain righteousness on you.
You*ln have plowed wickedness, you have reaped injustice, You*ln have eaten the fruit of lies. Because*ln you have trusted in your way, in your numerous warriors,

Therefore*ln a tumult will arise among your people, And*ln all your fortresses will be destroyed, As*ln Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel on the day of battle, When*iln mothers were dashed in pieces with their*i children.
Thus*ln it will be done to you at Bethel because of your great wickedness. At*ln dawn the king of Israel will be completely cut off.
Hosea 11
God Yearns over His People
When*pn Israel was*i a youth I loved him, And*ln out of Egypt I called My son.
The*ln more they called them, The*ln more they went from them; They*ln kept sacrificing to the Baals And*ln burning incense to idols.
Yet*ln it is I who taught Ephraim to walk, I*ln took them in My arms; But*ln they did not know that I healed them.
I*ln led them with cords of a man, with bonds of love, And*ln I became to them as one who lifts the yoke from their jaws; And*ln I bent down and*i fed them.
They*ln will not return to the land of Egypt; But*ln Assyria—he will be their king Because*ln they refused to return to*i Me.*i
The*ln sword will whirl against their cities, And*ln will demolish their gate bars And*ln consume them*i because of their counsels.
So*ln My people are bent on turning from Me. Though*ln they call them to the*i One*i on high, None*ln at all exalts Him.*i

How*ln can I give you up, O Ephraim? How*ln can I surrender you, O Israel? How*ln can I make you like Admah? How*ln can I treat you like Zeboiim? My*ln heart is turned over within Me, All*ln My compassions are kindled.
I*ln will not execute My fierce anger; I*ln will not destroy Ephraim again. For*ln I am God and not man, the Holy One in your midst, And*ln I will not come in wrath.
They*ln will walk after the Lord,*s He*ln will roar like a lion; Indeed*ln He will roar And*ln His*i sons will come trembling from the west.
They*ln will come trembling like birds from Egypt And*ln like doves from the land of Assyria; And*ln I will settle them in their houses, declares the Lord.*s
Ephraim*ln surrounds Me with lies And*ln the house of Israel with deceit; Judah*ln is also unruly against God, Even*ln against the Holy One who is faithful.
Hosea 12
Ephraim Reminded
Ephraim*pn feeds on wind, And*ln pursues the east wind continually; He*ln multiplies lies and violence. Moreover,*ln he makes a covenant with Assyria, And*ln oil is carried to Egypt.
The*ln Lord*s also has a dispute with Judah, And*ln will punish Jacob according to his ways; He*ln will repay him according to his deeds.
In*ln the womb he took his brother by the heel, And*ln in his maturity he contended with God.
Yes,*ln he wrestled with the angel and prevailed; He*ln wept and sought His favor. He*ln found Him at Bethel And*ln there He spoke with us,
Even*ln the Lord,*s the God of hosts, The*ln Lord*s is His name.
Therefore,*ln return to your God, Observe*ln kindness and justice, And*ln wait for your God continually.
A*ln merchant, in whose hands are false balances, He*ln loves to oppress.
And*ln Ephraim said, “Surely I have become rich, I*ln have found wealth for myself; In*ln all my labors they will find in me No*ln iniquity, which would*i be*i sin.”
But*ln I have*i been*i the Lord*s your God since the land of Egypt; I*ln will make you live in tents again, As*ln in the days of the appointed festival.
I*ln have also spoken to the prophets, And*ln I gave numerous visions, And*ln through the prophets I gave parables.
Is*ln there iniquity in*i Gilead? Surely*ln they are worthless. In*ln Gilgal they sacrifice bulls, Yes,*ln their altars are like the stone heaps Beside*ln the furrows of the field.
Now*ln Jacob fled to the land of Aram, And*ln Israel worked for a wife, And*ln for a wife he kept sheep.*i
But*ln by a prophet the Lord*s brought Israel from Egypt, And*ln by a prophet he was kept.
Ephraim*ln has provoked to bitter anger; So*ln his Lord will leave his bloodguilt on him And*ln bring back his reproach to him.
Hosea 13
Ephraim’s Idolatry
When*pn Ephraim spoke, there*i was*i trembling. He*ln exalted himself in Israel, But*ln through Baal he did wrong and died.

And*ln now they sin more and more, And*ln make for themselves molten images, Idols*ln skillfully made from their silver, All*ln of them the work of craftsmen. They*ln say of them, “Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
Therefore*ln they will be like the morning cloud And*ln like dew which soon disappears, Like*ln chaff which is blown away from the threshing floor And*ln like smoke from a chimney.
Yet*ln I have*i been*i the Lord*s your God Since*ln the land of Egypt; And*ln you were not to know any god except Me, For*ln there is no savior besides Me.
I*ln cared for you in the wilderness, In*ln the land of drought.
As*ln they*i had*i their pasture, they became satisfied, And*ln being satisfied, their heart became proud; Therefore*ln they forgot Me.
So*ln I will be like a lion to them; Like*ln a leopard I will lie in wait by the wayside.
I*ln will encounter them like a bear robbed of her cubs, And*ln I will tear open their chests; There*ln I will also devour them like a lioness, As*iln a wild beast would tear them.
It*iln is*i your destruction, O Israel, That*ln you*i are*i against Me, against your help.
Where*ln now is your king That*ln he may save you in all your cities, And*ln your judges of whom you requested, “Give*ln me a king and princes”?
I*ln gave you a king in My anger And*ln took him away in My wrath.
The*ln iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; His*ln sin is stored up.
The*ln pains of childbirth come upon him; He*ln is not a wise son, For*ln it is not the time that he should delay at the opening of the womb.
Shall*ln I ransom them from the power of Sheol? Shall*ln I redeem them from death? O*ln Death, where are your thorns? O*ln Sheol, where is your sting? Compassion*ln will be hidden from My sight.

Though*ln he flourishes among the reeds, An*ln east wind will come, The*ln wind of the Lord*s coming up from the wilderness; And*ln his fountain will become dry And*ln his spring will be dried up; It*ln will plunder his*i treasury of every precious article.

Samaria*ln will be held guilty, For*ln she has rebelled against her God. They*ln will fall by the sword, Their*ln little ones will be dashed in pieces, And*ln their pregnant women will be ripped open.
Hosea 14
Israel’s Future Blessing
Return,*pn O Israel, to the Lord*s your God, For*ln you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
